body.summary: Ace Alliance finds the Cardano Constitution v2.3 proposal to be **constitutional**.
body.rationaleStatement:
A [PDF version][pdf-link] of this rationale is also made available.

[pdf-link]: https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmYwhkNRgCMeXLmyFvNv6bnLk63u9oe8kJuo9jTDRiMUer

The proposed Cardano Blockchain Ecosystem Constitution v2.3 complies with the amendment requirements of Article VIII. It satisfies the documentation standards of Article III, Section 5, by providing immutable IPFS references, indicating differences from previous versions, and including supporting rationale.

This governance action seeks to reinforce the existing balance of powers between DReps, SPOs, and the Constitutional Committee without altering the framework established in the current Constitution.
body.precedentDiscussion:
According to Article VII, Section 1, the Constitutional Committee must assess the constitutionality of all Governance Actions, including New Constitution actions. Questions have been raised as to whether the Constitutional Committee should evaluate procedural, but not substantive aspects of New Constitution actions, citing the possibility that this body could block the collective will of ada holders.

Cardano is governed through a constitutional system where the values and requirements delineated in the Constitution are the foundational expression of the will of ada holders, immutably recorded on the blockchain. However, if the Constitutional Committee should block a New Constitution, the DReps selected by ada holders may pass an Update Committee action to replace members of the Constitutional Committee with new members who interpret the constitution in line with their current collective will.

This system enforces checks and balances between the governance bodies, where the eagerness of DReps to adopt a Constitution with new rules and possibly new values is tempered by the Constitutional Committeeâ€™s duty to evaluate such actions. When reviewing this or any future New Constitution action, we must determine whether we are willing to risk our tenure on the Constitutional Committee in order to stand for the position that it is unconstitutional.
body.counterargumentDiscussion: Some may raise concerns that updates to the Guardrails Appendix could alter treasury or network behavior in conflict with the written text of the Constitution. Independent review confirms that none of the amended guardrails are enforced by the on chain Guardrails Script. The change maintains both constitutional and operational continuity.
body.conclusion: The Cardano Constitution v2.3 proposal is constitutional, procedurally correct, and provides a consistent text for community consideration.

references.label: Independent Diff Analysis of Guardrails Appendix (v1.0 vs v2.3) (IPFS)
